conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the slope of the velocity-time graph for both objects at that point. The slope represents acceleration.
Identify the Slope at Time \( t_1 \): For both objects A and B, we need to find the slope of their respective velocity-time curves at \( t_1 \).
Determine the Slope of Object A: At \( t_1 \), draw a tangent to the curve of object A. The slope of this tangent line represents the acceleration of object A at \( t_1 \).
Determine the Slope of Object B: Similarly, at \( t_1 \), draw a tangent to the curve of object B. The slope of this tangent line represents the acceleration of object B at \( t_1 \).

premise: Compare the slopes of the tangents for both objects at \( t_1 \).
conclusion: If the slopes are equal, then the accelerations are the same.
From the graph, the tangent lines at \( t_1 \) for both objects are shown.
The slope of the tangent line for object A at \( t_1 \) appears to be the same as the slope for object B.

premise: Since the slopes of the tangent lines for both objects at time \( t_1 \) are the same, the accelerations of both objects at \( t_1 \) are equal.
conclusion: Yes, the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
